欲.definition: to wish for; to desire; variant of 慾|欲[yu4]

欲仙欲死.definition: (idiom) to experience sheer ecstasy (or, when used ironically, sheer hell)

欲加之罪，何患無辭.pinyin: yu4 jia1 zhi1 zui4 , he2 huan4 wu2 ci2
欲加之罪，何患無辭.definition: If you want to condemn sb, don't worry about the pretext (idiom, from Zuozhuan 左傳|左传); one can always trump up a charge against sb; Give a dog a bad name, then hang him.

欲取姑予.definition: variant of 欲取姑與|欲取姑与[yu4qu3-gu1yu3]

欲取姑與.definition: (idiom) to make concessions for the sake of future gains

欲振乏力.definition: to try to rouse oneself but lack the strength (idiom)

欲擒故縱.definition: In order to capture, one must let loose.; to loosen the reins only to grasp them better

欲海.definition: ocean of lust (Buddhist term); worldly desires

欲滴.definition: (suffix) replete (with moisture); glistening; plump and tender; lovely; alluring

欲益反損.definition: wishing for profit, but causing loss (idiom); good intentions that lead to disaster; It all ends in tears.

欲罷不能.definition: want to stop but can't (idiom); to be unable to stop oneself; to feel an urge to continue

欲蓋彌彰.definition: trying to hide it makes it more conspicuous (idiom); A cover up only makes matters worse.

欲言又止.definition: to want to say sth but then hesitate

欲速則不達.definition: (idiom) (the Analects) haste makes waste; things can't be rushed

欲速而不達.definition: see 欲速則不達|欲速则不达[yu4 su4 ze2 bu4 da2]
